items.title: fix: MD047 add single trailing newline

items.content_html:
It started out with how to use it, without much of a clue as to what it does or why you would want to use it. These objects should always start with a simplie description, so the reader doesn't have to read further to see if they care about it, or if it's what they're looking for.
Also converted some passive voice to active voice.

items.content_html: There is an issue with specifically setting the value as --- in config, because it flags the ones in blockquotes. I've created an upstream bug for that, but this still passes the full repo now
items.title: fix: MD035 consistent horizontal rule

items.content_html: Shouldn't affect rendering. Adjusted a few that didn't match the : trailing pattern leading into a list
items.title: fix: MD032 space around lists

items.content_html: Please update "dotted" to "dashed" given the fact that they are two separate and functional names for border styles.
items.title: Change "dotted" to "dashed".

items.content_html:
Summary

Misleading explanation of pseudo-class :active

Motivation

Currently the page states that:

Other common targets of this pseudo-class include elements that contain an activated element

As I understand an activated element may be <a> or <button> thus the sentence may be interpreted as this selector .elem a:active. I think it should be interpreted as a:active .elem. Proposed change is:

Other common targets of this pseudo-class include elements that contained in an activated element

Original document

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:active

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error

Related with #12061 and mdn/translated-content#3695
items.title: Fix misleading explanation of :active

I looked over the "overview pages" and noticed that little things differ - just for the sake of consistency of the pages...

items.title: Update index.md adapting the module title

items.content_html:
Summary

I updated the docs to the current spec in a very important aspect of it: the position of the Unlayered style layer.
Initially, it was supposed to be first (so overridable by layers), now it's last (overrides any layer).

Motivation

The spec changed 3 months ago, time to update your docs :)

The docs now should be correct at least, I'm not sure whether it's the better formulation as English is not my mother tongue.

Extra: the last LiveSample looks broken, no styling is applied at the moment.

Supporting details

w3c/csswg-drafts#6284 (comment)

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Update Unlayered styles always winning over Layered styles

Metadata

items.title: Update index.md

items.content_html:
On Chrome and Safari, when a request is aborted, its readyState is changed to XMLHttpRequest.DONE (4).

Summary

Change the readyState value when a request is aborted to XMLHttpRequest.DONE (4).

Motivation

I actually tested it in Chrome and Safari, when a request is aborted, its readyState is changed to XMLHttpRequest.DONE (4).

Supporting details

https://xhr.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-xmlhttprequest-abort

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Correct the readyState value after abort

items.content_html:
Summary

Adding documentation to Gamepad.vibrationActuator and GamepadHapticActuator.playEffect() following the current Gamepad Haptics API proposal implemented in browsers and providing examples of its usage.

Motivation

vibrationActuator and playEffect are available features on browsers, and besides the proposal document and some random issues on Github, there's no documentation available about them.

Supporting details

  • Gamepad Haptics API proposal
  • Vibrate feature for Gamepad #19

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Adding documentation to Gamepad vibrationActuator and playEffect

items.content_html:
Shrinking a 200-pixel item does not happen on large screens. So it is better to have a larger size so that readers do not have trouble understanding. Also you should change last CSS Demo size.
